I had to buy a large Patagonia messenger bag because it was the only bag wide enough (19") to accommodate the width of the computer (approx 18"). I'm a big guy so I can handle the computer but someone smaller might have problems carrying this computer around.Awesome computer. Perfect for drafting/design engineers....capable for gamers.Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Khanh P.
Reviews.Content: Honestly I love this laptop. The only problem I have is that it isn't very loud so outside sound source is a must

Reviews.Title: Awesome!..
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "p_parsell"
Reviews.Content: The laptop works great.. Just as I've read in the major reviews.. It was delivered as well as could be expected.. I am very happy.. :)

Reviews.Title: This is awesome
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: It works very well. I have yet to have any problems with it. I haven't had much time to use it

Reviews.Title: ASUS Republic of Gamers G75VW-AH71 17.3-Inch Gaming Laptop
Reviews.Author: PAE "PAE"
Reviews.Content: This computer is great, though Windows 8 sucks.  The only down-side is the DVD RW should also be a Blue-ray RW in this day and age.  Otherwise, great price, great deal and great computer.

Reviews.Title: smokin
Reviews.Author: ckegman
Reviews.Content: this is one smokin fast laptop. very well built. Is a little heavy but I wanted power and cooling and this laptop does it all. would buy again...

Reviews.Title: Best computer I've ever owned - Desktop Computer Killer
Reviews.Author: trf
Reviews.Content: After daily use for 6 months, I can say this simply outperforms any computer currently out there. Performance is through the roof. Easily replaced my 3 year old former 'top of the line' consumer desktop computer. Not any lagtime to be found. Fantastic design in venting eliminates any heat issues. Solid design and layout a plus. Nothing flimsey on this monster. I did purchase an oversized carrybag from Office Depot for those occassions this beast leaves my desk. Currently upgrading the hard drive to SSD. Can't wait to see those results. The speed of the USB3 ports have me spoiled. Have upgraded all my portable drives to USB3 for that reason. Can you tell I'm very happy with this purchase? It'll be a long time before I have to consider another computer purchase. If and when that does happen, ASUS Gaming Series will be my only consideration. No question about that.

Reviews.Title: 15s to open 5s to shut down
Reviews.Author: Yutao Lim
Reviews.Content: Like:1. Fast speed of operation2. Full HD display is awesome3. The amplifier enhances the experience of gaming4. The price is reasonableDislike:The case is made of plastic rather than mental, if it could be mental, that would be perfect

Reviews.Title: awesome laptop, but...
Reviews.Author: Osama almayyahi
Reviews.Content: read the whole review pls. when I first bought this computer it crashed on me like a hundred times. and I couldnt look up the problem because after the computer is on for a couple of minutes it shows me the glorious blue screen. I looked up the problem on my phone  but I couldnt come with straight answer so I updated all my drivers and it worked smoothly after that.it runs all my favorite games on max settings including BF3, metro and FC3. the design is brilliant. I would say it is the best computer for the money.this computer met every expectation of mine.

Reviews.Title: Beast of a laptop, great buy
Reviews.Author: Trey
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this laptop aside from in the beginning, there was an issue with the PC freezing every 2 minutes, very frustrating. Turned out to need the touchpad drivers updated (downloaded from ASUS's website) for windows 8. After installing the fix and rebooting, no problems, and love the speed of this laptop. I will be doing a memory upgrade in the near future along with a SSD, but as it sits right now, this laptop is fantastic at the price I bought it at (1300usd). I am going to put windows 7 on it when I get my SSD and then I think it will be even faster, although you can order it with Windows 7, I didnt want to wait as that model was backordered.

Reviews.Title: description
Reviews.Author: Dylan Wayne Treat
Reviews.Content: for all the people saying that they didnt gtt Nvidia GTX 670 its  not 670 if u would look at the description it says  quote Nvdia GTX 660 so why dont you please look more closely at the description please before complainin. thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, perfect for my uses.
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: This laptop is perfect.  Had it for a year now and it still performs the same as it did on day one.  It barely makes any noise and most importantly it does not over heat. My old HP overheated and melted the insides, so I made sure to find a new laptop that can prevent that which led me to this product. Im an engineering major so I use this for CAD designs, use photoshop, play games and also make music. This does all of that well without hindering the performance.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was expecting and wanted.
Reviews.Author: D. A. Brown
Reviews.Content: After my old laptop made it clear that it didn't like me or anything I did, I decided to buy a new computer. After some back and forth, I determined that being able to travel with the computer was a priority, so as much as I like the power and flexibility of desktops, it was a laptop for me.The second priority for me was cooling. My old laptop would overheat after maybe half an hour of video playback or about 15 minutes of even simple games.And of course, this all had to be balanced with performance. I'm not really into bleeding edge FPS action, so top notch super computers area waste of my money.I read the review (and recommend that you do) and this computer really stuck out. (Probably doesn't hurt that it's the first thing that comes up on Amazon for "gaming laptop". Or it was at the time, anyway. Who knows where it'll be when you read this. How many Fast and Furious movies do they have in your time? Do you still have gum?)!A quick disclaimer: on the advice of some friends, I pretty much immediately performed some steps and installed an app that makes Windows 8 act and look more like Windows 7. So the few performance issues I will mention soon may be related to that.!Pros:-Performs at exactly the level I want. Maybe more. Civ 5 on highest settings is as far as I've gone so far.-Cools great. It's not really meant to be on a lap, I don't think, as it is rather heavy, but if you don't mind that, you'll find that most of the heat exhausts out of the back. It gets a little warm underneath during longer sessions, so I may yet get a cooling pad, but it's not a huge concern. (And frankly, this behemoth is really all I can handle on my lap. *insert dirty joke here*)-Huge, good looking screen that is all but glare-proof.-Backlit keyboard. (Fn f4)-Comfortable hand rests.Cons:-The mousepad. Sometimes it doesn't respond for a few seconds, and sometimes, it senses a tap when I'm pretty sure I'm not tapping. It's also big, which is itself fine, but it means that when controlling using "wasd", you are going to brush it. Not a huge problem, as Fn f9 will turn the touch pad off, but kind of annoying.-It's only technically portable. The awesome cooling fans and the associated vents do mean that there is a small selection of bags that will fit it. (May I suggest the Everki Beacon laptop bag with gaming console sleeve, for which I am about to write a positive review when I am done here?)-Friggin' Windows 8, man. But there aren't many laptops without it. Suck it up, I guess. That's my advice.Overall, for the price, I feel like I got a great deal. I found out after I bought it that a friend of mine has the same model and really likes it, too.

Reviews.Title: What can I say, my second ASUS laptop
Reviews.Author: DrKillPatient "DrKillPatient"
Reviews.Content: Update 9/19: Just swapped out the old disk for a 1TB SSD (Crucial). Talk about fast. Just FYI - Win 8 still has the Win 7 backup image capability, so I was able to create the image, swap the disks, restore the image. No issues. I have had no issues with the unit since purchase.Pros: allI also have a G73J which I just gave to my son. This is all that plus a few extras...extras: Card slot, USB 3.0. almost 2 lbs lighter. Ability to clean fan filters (big)...The old G73J was having a heating problem. I happen to have a micro vacuum with a long slender tube we could use to clean it out. Back to normal now.This one has a way more convenient way to make sure all is clean and tidy with the fans. Plus extra filters included. I opened the rear panels thinking they had to be installed, but ones were already there. RTM for details.Futuremark: put this exactly where I expected, midrange gaming which is where I am at. Over 400-500plus FPS on simple graphics, 50+ on mid range (full screen), 15 on EXTREME. These results were expected. This is not an SLI box.Windows 8: everyone stop whining. Maybe because I have had experience with KDE, GNOME, CDE, Win (all...I mean all). The first boot was a bit confusing, but after about an hour it was no big deal. For me, Live Tiles is not an added on, put I have already pinned to the taskbar everything I need.If you are on Live Tiles, right click, lower right to get all apps. From there you can select any app and have it pinned to the taskbar for Desktop mode. No biggy.Unlike others (a few in this forum) I have seen NO performance degradation with Win 8.Excellent value, highly recommended.One nit (not even a con): would have preferred a 7200 rpm disk, but I can do that anytime I feel like it. Maybe even add a SSD.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: Huckleberry
Reviews.Content: I could not decide between the Asus G75 and the Samsung Series 7 NP700Z7C-S01US (both 17.3" screens with 1TB drive and 8GB of memory) so I bought 1 of each.Side by side shoot out:Samsung: GOOD-looks and feels 90% like a Mac book, which I liked.-better lighted keyboard-better battery life-better sound-great screenSamsung: BAD-the wireless antenna on the Samsung is a crap design, as part of the aluminum case I read, and has 1/2 the power/distance of the Asus. Sitting in my living room (35' from the Airport Extreme router) the Asus runs at basically the same speed as on my desk, but the Samsung runs at 1/3 slower and buffers video.  10' further on our dining room table the Asus runs just a bit slower and the Samsung swings from no signal to 4 out of 6 bars without being moved or touched, and another 10' on the porch the Samsung has no signal.-Runs hot-touch pad is almost unusable-not upgradeableAsus: Good-runs fast-quite even with fans on high-cool in lap-great screen-upgradeableAsus: Bad-the G75 at Best Buy on display had already had the screen go bad, so I guess I'll just have to keep the protection plan on it.-case is matte and shows every finger print-hard to open screen (no finger slot)-so so soundshort battery life (4-5 hours)Doing a restore on the Samsung and returning it, which stinks because I liked it a little bit better for the sound and weight, but that does not matter if you can't use it in the primary place I bought it for.

Reviews.Title: Worst customer service you will ever experience!
Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: Do NOT deal with Asus. If you ever have any problems with your laptop you can expect ludicrous long, and multiple repairs. I have a G75 that has been serviced by their repair contractor abroad as it broke while I was on vacation. Their international warranty is a total joke. My laptop had to go in for faulty speakers, gpu/motherboard, monitor, wifi module, and an ac adapter problem which caused the case to melt around the ac-in cover. After about 3 weeks those things were fixed and I got it back with a messed up audio card, and the psu died as soon as I plugged it in. I sent it back in and it has now been almost SIX weeks and there is still no expected completion date. Their repair contractor has submitted an application to have the cost of the laptop credited back to me as Asus hasn't been able to provide them with the necessary parts in almost six weeks! I haven't had my laptop up and running since July, and they've done absolutely NOTHING to remedy the situation. Save yourself the hassle and go with Samsung, Alienware, MSI, or whatever other manufacturer, but stay FAR away from Asus. After purchasing 3 of their "high end" gaming laptops I will never deal with this company for the rest of my life, and will recommend anyone I talk to to do the same.

Reviews.Title: Better Buy a Warranty
Reviews.Author: Coastie071
Reviews.Content: So far I have been extremely satisfied with this computer, but I may have a lemon, more on that later.  First, the basics:The package arrived on time, and in good condition.  The computer was very simple to start, and setup to my desires.  The video card needed an updated driver, but everything else was up to date.  There was some "fluff" software, but nothing too annoying.  The computer looks sharp, and most settings are easily changed.  I especially liked the backlit keyboardGraphically, the computer works great.  Its able to run most games on the highest, or second highest setting.  I ran Skyrim, heavily loaded with high-res texture mods with no issues at all.  Nvidia is also extremely easy to deal with if you're unfamiliar with drivers and software.Sound wise, this computer is a bit of a failure, though not in a "game breaking" way.  The speakers are lackluster, and don't put out too much sound.  The computer also has an awful time recognizing sound hardware.  If you're in the middle of a game, and your SO asks you to kill the sound, your only option is to mute it (which is easy given shortcut keys on the keyboard), or to exit the game, and put in headphones.  The laptop will not input any already running sound into the headphones, so you must completely shut down whatever game/video/program, you're running, put in headphones, then restart.  Even then you will occasionally get sound on both the speakers, and headphones, forcing another full restart.If you'd have asked me what I thought about this laptop two weeks ago, I would have said 4 stars.  Its a great computer, that runs fantastically, for a reasonable price.  However, exactly one week after the manufacturer warranty expired my computer refused to start.  While I am not an expert, I believe the BIOS card has broken.  Luckily I had purchased a warranty (via square trade, so far service has been great).  Even if I hadn't purchased a warranty, I am confident that Amazon.com would repair/replace it given how close it is to the original warranty.  Nonetheless, it is unacceptable for a product this expensive, to have such a fundamental failure, so early in its service life.While I will continue to use this computer if it can be repaired, I definitely won't purchase an ASUS again, and I strongly recommend any one thinking of purchasing this laptop to get am extended warranty with it.

Reviews.Title: Stop and read this before purchasing
Reviews.Author: K. Roark
Reviews.Content: I've had my Asus G75 series (nVidia 660m, 16gb ram, win. 7) for nearly six months now and love the machine. I feel it's the perfect fit for the average-to-avid gamer/college student, and at a price that can't be beaten. That being said, here are my biggest gripes and most important pieces of advice for anyone who's considering a purchase.1. The audio bug many reviews speak of was/is a driver-related issue. If you have no gripes about day-1 updating (you should always do this anyway) then the issue is resolved after installing the updated audio and chipset drivers.2. Asus' customer service isn't as poor as some would make it out to be. I've spoken with them often about the audio issue (and another issue I've had that I'll cover later in more detail) and have always dealt with helpful and generally knowledgeable people.3. The touchpad is buggy at times. Even after turning the multi-touch function off (highly recommended, it's not usually worth using), I still experience issues where the cursor will jump either to the far left or near-bottom of the screen. It's most pronounced when dragging the scroll bar on a browser page, but can occur at any time. This issue is confined to the touchpad though, so it won't be a problem when using a mouse.4. The 660m is plenty to run most games at max to near-max settings without any issues. Some complaints of the card not keeping up come from the same issue my machine has.And the big issue, which is the whole reason I'm taking the time to write this review:5. The G75 comes standard with an Atheros wireless card. The issue arises from Atheros' hit-or-miss driver and card production. In short, you may/will have lag spikes due to DPC latency. In layman's terms, WiFi gaming can be anywhere from flawless to completely unplayable. Asus can't fix it over the phone if one of their driver updates or a clean windows install doesn't fix it, it's really a hassle, and the odds of the problem popping back up are medium to high. My suggestion to you if seriously considering this or any Asus laptop is to have an online PC builder such as xoticpc or any other reputable site you trust build one for you with an upgraded wireless card. You'll spend $50-100 more and miss out on amazon prime 2-day shipping if you have the option, but it's well worth it to avoid the hassle and still keep your Asus factory warranty. In addition, you can also grab a few more bells and whistles if you want them while you're there.Were I able to go back six months and make a different decision on which high-end laptop I purchased, the only thing I would change would be the wireless card. All of Asus' other shortcomings are forgivable, easily fixed, and shouldn't deter an individual looking to own one.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it wonderful!!
Reviews.Author: Christian Madigan "tavio"
Reviews.Content: Ok guys So I work on private boats and iv had to always get laptops for my. Gaming needs I was one of the first t get a 17inch laptop from gateway back in 2000 so I have had them all including theDell mx2010 21" lap top (full speck price 11.000)Alien wear mx18 (full spec 6.000)Eurocom pantha 2.1 (full spec 15.000)I still have  my eurocom must admit that is a monster! But is heavy!Iv pretty much just seen the best laptops and brought.. For what in my eyes the more you pay the better you get..How wrong I was this little puppy.. With a price tag of only 1.300 out shines the alienwear by a huge market.If you wanted the same specs from them it would cost you well over 3 grandSo this laptop is great it really is.. The build quality is a little platicish but honestly it's what's inside that counds right?Alien wear. Is like that hot girl you listed after in high school.. Once you finally got the nerv to go up and talk to her.. She turned out to be a raciest neo natzi pycho!. What a turn off!This ausu.. Is the girl in the corner.. You never see her.. Until your in the croner with her.. And once you doWow! Funny smart and will run anything you put through her! With ouT any back talk!Ideal times boys and girls.. Ideal times!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop especially at 800 dollars.
Reviews.Author: Marquel Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop from newegg for 819 dollars. It was refurbished but it arrived in almost brand new condition and so far so good. The laptop I ordered off Newegg actually has a better processor than this one. It has the i7 3630qm. Everything else is basically the same. It's not the fastest out there but it plays pretty much every game on high or ultra settings.This laptop never overheats even after hours of gaming on it. The cooling design is ingenious. I mostly owned toshiba laptops but decided to try asus because I got it for a very good price. I owned alienware and there is just no comparison this laptop is much much much better and affordable. Alienware is waaay overpriced compared to this.

Reviews.Title: pretty good gaming pc
Reviews.Author: Charles Song
Reviews.Content: i wouldve given it 5 stars but the price dropped again right after i bought one. other than that great gaming latop

Reviews.Title: Great machine Hreat Price
Reviews.Author: isabel chaparro
Reviews.Content: I used to play on a Mac Book Pro. It was getting a little old, so I found this product and bought it. At first, windows had some problems with some video drivers, but besides that, the machine is super nice. It's a little heavy and I'm a small girl, so sometimes it can get heavy to lift it from the floor. My cats love those fans that keep them warm so now they don't bother me seeking for attention...

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop!
Reviews.Author: Charles M. Gillum
Reviews.Content: So i was a bit apprehensive about purchasing this laptop at first because the thought of tackling Windows 8 was a bit intimidating. I have to say that I'm very impressed with that OS and I think if anyone is having the same reservations, they should make the switch. For the laptop, I love the display, the speed is phenominal, and I couldn't be happier with the design. I had an N71JQ that fried itself after 4 years. I think this was because the AC plug was right next to the fan and the computer itself was basically a blowdryer, billowing out hot air. With the design of the G75, they've made the fans point backward away from you and anything you may have on the side. Great choice, in my opinion. My only complaint is that the built in sound system doesn't hold a candle to my old ASUS laptop. That being said, you can easily remedy this by using a nice pair of headphones. If they wanted to perfect the design, they would improve upon that aspect. Other than that, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Dream!
Reviews.Author: brunofmpereira
Reviews.Content: Too big, but respond well.It works just like i want! The first computer i buy that don't disapoint me!

Reviews.Title: Worth
Reviews.Author: Josh Zhang
Reviews.Content: I think it's the best computer you can buy with this amount of money, but if you want to run some really high quality games, you are not gonna like it.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Richard P Grant
Reviews.Content: I use the laptop for use with engineering / 3D mapping mapping applications - very fast.  Also works great for virtual machines.  One small note however, its difficult to find a laptop sleeve / case / backpack due to the dimensions.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for Gamers
Reviews.Author: Evandro Bottecchia
Reviews.Content: I bought for my son and he loved. I strongly recommend this computer for any game lover. Enjoy it and have fun

Reviews.Title: good deal for the price
Reviews.Author: dark
Reviews.Content: amazing laptop with this kind price ,i like this shape a lot. and it runs very well to me ,anyway ready good.

Reviews.Title: Solid Machine
Reviews.Author: Leo Cruise
Reviews.Content: Good:-Beautiful Design, looks better than the g74-Keyboard, the keys feel good to me. Spacey and you have lots of shortcuts!-Trackpad. Requires some tweaking, mostly with the "asus smart detector." Make the detection circle as big as possible/custom. If you need even more responsiveness check it off. With the right adjustments, the trackpad can come close to an apple. It doesn't have the apple 2 finger right click, but I like the quick minimize function. The apple 2 finger scrolling works best with the "asus smart detector" turned off.-Good Price.-Runs cool.Bad:-Speakers are HORRIBLE. I thought people were being too picky when commenting about the bad sound. I concur that the sound is crap. Totally different class from the ipads/apple sound system. Don't expect anything close to the macs. You'll get better sound on dells. The company states that these are "hd premium speakers" Don't believe it, more like 50 cent crap, and tweaking them don't do much. With that said, you can still watch youtube videos. With music, movies, and games, you better hook up your own speakers or headphones.-Scrolling is very jerky. If you want smooth mac scrolling you need to download third party software, and even then.. However, there is a free extension for google chrome that's pretty good. But, for all other applications your eyes may hurt, if you're used to apple.-Screen. Viewing angle is small and not as clear as I expected. But, for the budget price, it's good enough.Overall:May not be as clean as the Macs, but it costs $1000.00+ less! If you have a big wallet, get a mac. If not, or your primary purpose is gaming, Asus is pretty darn good.

Reviews.Title: Hmmm
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: When I was underway, I bought the LAPTOP a few days after it came out (my first ASUS product). Worked and looked amazing. Very impressed with the performance and looks. Was playing SKYRIM like a CHAMP with no lag what so ever. About a month and a half I went to turn it on, broken. The keyboard lights would light up and attempt to fully power up but it would shut off after a few seconds. The screen wouldn't turn on. What really pissed me off is that you have to pay out of pocket to ship your product to a service center. If I pay $1500 for an FN laptop, the company should ship you a no shipping cost box. I will never buy an ASUS product again. Oh, the issue with my laptop was a bad Mother Board. On a positive note, they repaired and shipped it back fast but will never by from again.-Dave

Reviews.Title: Bad Screen
Reviews.Author: LILI WANG
Reviews.Content: Overall, the computer is amazing. I love the raw speed and its large memory size.What kills me about this product is the SCREEN!!!! On the product description, it says that this is a 1920 x 1080 hd screen. Well, let me tell you, the screen is no where close to that. The pixels on the screen are very noticeable, i have tried to tweek all the contrast ratio and resolution changes, even at the highest 1920 x 1080 resolution, the screen looks like looking though a "bug screen" that you use to keep bugs out of your room.The pixels are less noticeable on dark images, however, especially on white backgrounds such as web most web pages, and visual studio, the perfectly square pixels are very noticeable. The perfectly horizontally and vertically align pixels are more than enough to drive a person insane!!!I don't know if its just this product or the particular laptop that i revived, but i am not taking the chance by replacing my current one with another one of this.

Reviews.Title: Control Yourself!  Don't Buy It!!
Reviews.Author: J. George
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this computer!!  It has only one good point. The processor is very fast but beyond that i find nothing to recommend it.  The mouse pad often times does not respond to touch and the screen display is constantly resizing itself for no apparent reason. If I barely touch the ASD and F keys similataineously all kind of wierd things happen to the display.  (screen goes to black, or resizes itself, or  the text jumps around on the page, or the curser wont work.  It is really a bare bones computer with a fast processor.  Trying to turn audio up or down is maddening.  There is no number lock light or caps lock light.  The display picture quality is very disappointing.  Video that looks great on other computers or tablets looks washed out and grainy on this thing.  I  even sent the first one back and the replacement was exactly the same.  I think ASUS figures kids will be buying this thing and as long as games work well, they wont notice all the other problems

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: T. East "green witch"
Reviews.Content: not a bad computer overall.  Not really happy with the sound and speakers. Expected alot better in that area since it is a gaming computer. Not really fond of the setup either. On a good note, it plays mass effect 3, skyrim, and guildwars 2 with no problems at all. It doesn't overheat and plays them on high settings.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this computer, spend some extra money and buy another gaming laptop.
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: The screen died after 2 days and the whole screen has to be replaced. Even if you have warranty, it is very inconvienent to have to post it back to Asus and not be able to use it. Don't buy this if you are going to use it for buisness or study. It could cost you a lot. The cost of a large parcel for a 5kg item is expensive and it adds extra cost. This whole experience has been very costly for me. I have a 5 year old Compaq Presario, that I'm forced to use and its still working, but Asus died after 2 days. It's pathetic.Look at all the topics on the Asus ROG forum and other reviews complaining about the sound. I discovered that myself. When you plug the headphones in, the speaker keeps working when you don't want it to. Asus hasn't done a thing about this.A lot of people check out the negative reviews before they buy something and I hope this negative review will cost Asus thousands of dollars in lost buisness, that is the least they deserve. I'm stuck with this lemon for the next few years. This laptop is like a coffin, it looks good on the outside, but it's rotten on the inside.

Reviews.Title: Asus  G75VW-AS71 17.3 inch laptop
Reviews.Author: Mar
Reviews.Content: I just purchased it online few weeks ago and it is no longer good.  Every time I use it or watch DVD, it always stop or hung and I have to start all over again.

Reviews.Title: Rental???
Reviews.Author: Terry Tewell
Reviews.Content: Why do I start my review "Rental". Asus has too much control ovr this laptop...while trying to upgrade to Win 8, which I purchased separately. You can't do a clean install. If you try the conventional way, (something I always try to do) you will find that you aren't allowed to do this. You can't install over the hard drive and you can't re-format. If you try to do this it will tell you that this partition can't be used. That includes all the pre-installed partitions. Asus still owns my laptop. Now according to the instructions I have to send MY laptop back to Asus so they can reinstall their bloat ware and their software priorities. $1279.99!!!!! and I am not allowed operate MY property the way I want too...on second thought I am changing my rating to 1 star. *Update...While on a weekend trip this past weekend Dec. 28 2012, my apartment was broken into and the laptop my Acer tablet and a point and shoot Sony camera and around 300.00 dollars cash were stolen. What a Godsend...since I have a very good renters insurance plan, I already have a check in the mail from State Farm. I am overjoyed that I won't have to have this boat anchor in my house. YES! it was that bad that I celebrate this particular robbery. Terry

Reviews.Title: Battery - Plugged in , not charging
Reviews.Author: chen
Reviews.Content: I tried a few ways by searching google , it looks like a software glitch. But it happened again after I "solves" the battery problem.

Reviews.Title: Description is WRONG
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M Hernandez
Reviews.Content: This item is listed as a Quad Core 2.3 GHz in the description however when we got the item it is a single 2.4 GHz.  After we received it we looked further down and there is a second description for it as a 2.4 GHz but what we looked at was the description at the top, right by the price, listing it as a Quad Core.  My son was very upset by this, he is a big gamer and was expecting, well, what we thought we ordered.  They need to correct the description or send us the quad core!We of course can and will return it but again, just upset that we didn't get what we ordered, what was listed in the description.

Reviews.Title: Beware buying expensive electronic equipment through Amazon
Reviews.Author: Weeeeewl
Reviews.Content: This laptop purchased in Sept 2012 for nearly $1,400 and registered with ASUS is defective and needs to be returned. It is now booting into a black screen, which is typically a hardware issue. We hear Windows complete startup, so it is likely a bad LVDS cable connection, bad cable, electrical short, or faulty power supply. Apparently other users have encountered this same issue.Regardless of the cause, we now to exchange the defective laptop for a new unit. I do not wish to, nor should I, deal with an RMA. And I do not want wait for ASUS to repair a brand new laptop. I want one that works or I will accept the refund if this model is out of stock.Amazon is refusing to refund or replace as we are past their "Oct. 14" refund deadline despite the fact that this is defective merchandise, and a particularly expensive electronic item.  I will also complain via the BBB and any other agency available to me andI would advise any potential buyer to think twice before placing an order for this or any other electronic item offered by Amazon over $300.

Reviews.Title: Question: Does it ship with backpack and mouse like G74 did?
Reviews.Author: SG "SG"
Reviews.Content: Called Amazon and confirmed G75 doesn't come with mouse or backpack like G74s die.Does the palm rest get dirty as some users mentioned?  Is it necessary to get a laminate for the palm rest?I'm thining of getting the 3D version. In G74 model, the 3D screen was significantly brighter, so i'm hoping 3D version in G75 will also be brighter.I'd like to add 32GB instead of 16GB.  There are four slots so can add 4x8GB 1600...Also will add intel wireless network card, with bluetooth, for greater range than Atheros chip many seem to complain about.Curious why some customer's mentioned GTX670 isn't best idea because it could burn out?  I'm naive and never heard of GPU's burning out if system was keep cool.Would like to add SSD 256 as boot drive.Any and all comments welcome

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: 747nemesis
Reviews.Content: I just got this laptop and tried to play a song on youtube and i got the blue screen of death when the bass went too high. otherwise looks great, feels lighter than g74 . fit and finish is excellent. I will update in a few days if i get the problem again.(update)the subwoofer completely stopped working. I am really disappointed. I've asked for a replacement. Giving asus one last tryThings just got worse. Games were running great until now, now the same games on low setting are lagging.

Reviews.Title: Worst laptop you can find
Reviews.Author: Jack Bauer
Reviews.Content: Cheap plastic, poor hadware, auto restarting, high price, i really suggest you switch to another brand, regreted shopping! This product should be cancelled.

Reviews.Title: Graphics subpar
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: Bought the Best Buy version of this recently for Diablo 3.  I already have a desktop with GTX 460 and i5-2500k, so I wanted something that could play with reasonable framerates and have portability.Even with resolution turned down and effects to low, dungeons on solo were choppy -- not talking just low framerate, but skipping (and not due to latency).  I knew mobile video cards were not as strong as the desktop versions but contrary to the other reviews on this page, Diablo 3 was not "smooth as butter" on this thing.  Not even close.Returned it within 10 days.

Reviews.Title: Horrible first impression of asus
Reviews.Author: HunterRose
Reviews.Content: pros-somewhat decent screen-good overall performancecons-poor audio quality-horrible track pad-cheap keys-poor customer supportPurchased this laptop to replace my aging, but still great, hp dragon.This Asus was disappointing from the moment I took it from the box.The screen is okay, but no where near my lower resolution five year old hp dragon or any of its competitors for that matter ie. msi,dell or Samsung. The speakers are horrible even though they added a sub woofer. The worst part of my experience with this Asus, and the reason I have returned it, was the faulty audio andtrack pad.I took the time to look at a number of the newer ivy bridge laptops in store and I have already ordered a msi gt70 because of the better screen,audio, and gpu for the same price. The only bright side to this story is the excellent service I received through amazon as usual.
